Description: Hand-modelled terracotta whistle, still working, made of a greenish-buff marl ware, with some mica, roughly in the shape of an animal’s head (hound? pig?), with an added spur on the top, not unlike ears.
Curator's comments: "Whistle in the form of an animal's head, blown through the mouth", "drab pottery" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 71.
BM Terracotta IV Very near to BM Terracotta 3702. Bibliog. Petrie et al. 1888: 74. For the Fort at Daphnae, see Boardman 1999: 133–5.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 71)
Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3701)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.57, p.178, pl.20)
